JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant bought a share in some land ( plot no . CARDINAL ) which was jointly owned by several other persons , in the Kadıköy district of GPE . According to the title - deed the applicant ’s share corresponded to CARDINAL/CARDINAL of the plot . The applicant submitted a copy of a map dated DATE where he is mentioned as the owner of the part of the land designated as no . CARDINAL in plot no . CARDINAL ( hereinafter “ land no . CARDINAL ” ) , which was QUANTITY in size .

CARDINAL . By decision no . CARDINAL dated CARDINAL DATE , GPE divided the property amongst its owners and created separate titles . The applicant was allocated the part of the land designated as no . CARDINAL in plot no . CARDINAL . It appears that the Municipality allocated parcel no . CARDINAL to a firm .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant filed an action with ORG against GPE , requesting the annulment of decision no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request to prevent the transfer of the allocated plot of land to third persons , ORG stayed the execution of the LOC ’s decision no . CARDINAL . The court file , the application of the LOC ’s decision no . ORG would engender irremediable damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the firm sold its land to another person , PERSON PERSON , who in turn sold it to Mr GPE on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG annulled the part of the GPE ’s decision affecting the applicant on the ground that it was unlawful . The court , after having examined the evidence in the case file and the experts’ report , held that the value of the land allocated to the applicant by the GPE ’s decision was inferior to the value of the applicant ’s parcel , and that there was a building on it which belonged to third persons . Therefore the Municipality had attributed the impugned land to the applicant without sufficient investigation and examination .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE the applicant filed an action requesting ORG to annul the title deed of the firm to land no . DATE and to register it under his name in the land registry . Mr PERSON , the owner of the land at that time , also joined the proceedings . It appears that on CARDINAL DATE the court issued a temporary injunction to prevent to transfer of the land to third parties . On DATE the court dismissed the case . This action ended with dismissal on the ground that the applicant did not have locus standi since the administrative proceedings concerning the annulment of decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL were still pending before the courts . This judgment became final on DATE when ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal and subsequent rectification request . On DATE the first - instance court lifted the temporary injunction .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court . On DATE it dismissed the ORG ’s request for rectification of its decision .

CARDINAL . The criminal proceedings instigated , upon the applicant ’s complaint , against the mayor of ORG , the director and co - director of construction affairs of the GPE and the vice chairman in charge of construction affairs were suspended , pursuant to LAW no . DATE , on DATE .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , the applicant applied , without success , to various authorities requesting their assistance in the enforcement of the judgment given in his favour and the re - inscription of the title deed of land no . CARDINAL in his name . The latest such petition was dated DATE and addressed to LOC . In this petition , the applicant referred to GPE response dated DATE where he was informed that it was not possible to enforce the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and that he could lodge an action against the firm and PERSON PERSON
CARDINAL . According to the land registry record dated DATE the applicant remained the owner of land no . DATE , which is QUANTITY in size .

CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law at the material time can be found in GPE and GPE and Others v. GPE ( nos . GPE , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL and GPE , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
